qas.question: The search for mysticism in the Dominican Order goes back to what?
Who wanted to put mysticism into the Dominican Order?
Whose writings introduced the idea of 'unknowing' to the Order of Preachers?
What concept does not reach back to the Hebrew Bible?
What tradition believed that it was possible to come face to face with God?
What does the commandment of Exodus 20.4-5 allow?
Who did not want to instill mysticism in the Dominican order?
What writings introduced the idea of "knowing" to the Order of Preachers?

context: Although <a2_0><b7_0>Albertus Magnus<b7_0/><a2_0/> did much to instill <b4_0>mysticism<b4_0/> in the Order of Preachers, it is a concept that reaches back to the <a0_0>Hebrew <a1_0>Bible<a1_0/><a0_0/>. In the <b5_0>tradition of Holy Writ<b5_0/>, the impossibility of coming face to face with God is a recurring motif, thus the commandment against <b6_0>graven images<b6_0/> (Exodus 20.4-5). As time passed, <a3_0><b8_0>Jewish and early Christian<b8_0/> writings<a3_0/> presented the idea of 'unknowing,' where God's presence was enveloped in a dark cloud. These images arose out of a confusing mass of ambiguous and ambivalent statements regarding the nature of God and man's relationship to Him.
